jurisdiction.title: Laurent Clerc National Deaf Education Center and California School for the Deaf-Fremont

D57FB77B5064428E88A19A958264D38A.description:
Use chaining strategy when introducing new vocabulary
words and signs (e.g., signs a word–WISE, fingerspells fs-W-IS-E, signs WISE).

9EE21FBE14824D39B4F7FEAB00CB35FE.description:
Fingerspell longer words and phrases following correct
contour as new ASL and English lexicon expands.

F87DC50874784FB9A2BE712D43E55984.description:
Know and apply grade-level parameters and sign analysis skills
in decoding signs both in isolation and in context.

FA6D1E7A886C469495731DBF38F39F67.description:
Connect initialized forms and alphabet letters to their
equivalent in English (e.g., B-T on chest = Board of Trustees).

6420BCDEFA0B4C35BE218EA66CFF53D4.description:
Demonstrate understanding of initialized and lexicalized forms
of fingerspelled words.

7FBD0A1437C145D7B7782649690222C2.description:
Recognize that fingerspelling can use space to establish
referents and/or to clarify meaning.

F16B274A6E7F4791B75DAF98D154CCED.description: Use fingerspelling to highlight titles of works (e.g., fs-S-NO-W fs-W-H-I-T-E; Valli’s fs-D-A-N-D-E-L-I-O-N-S).

2FB93F3288C0441B8CCD03D1595C451A.description:
Understand that words are fingerspelled when there are
no sign equivalents (e.g., proper nouns, technology terms,
vegetables).

EF8078A3B1554961A36624C7E7B4BABB.description:
Use fingerspelling to highlight a word in presentation or
discourse for emphasis.

0ECA2DAC89984347B6638610548FE8A3.description:
Demonstrate understanding of initialized and lexicalized forms
of fingerspelled words

9905966D43854A6983DCA832F295246B.description:
Acquire and use accurately grade-appropriate general
academic and domain-specific signs, fingerspelled words, and
phrases, including those that signal precise actions, emotions,
or states of being (e.g., PUZZLED, STUMPED) and that are
basic to a particular topic (e.g., ANIMALS, PRESERVE, and
DANGER+SHRINK) when discussing animal preservation).

56E71AD037CB43B3B37DC4078F7E4AC5.description:
Demonstrate understanding of signs by relating them to
their sign families based on sign locations, handshapes,
etc. (e.g., index finger signs often mean line of thought
[WONDER, THOUGHT+DISAPPEAR]; middle finger signs
often mean feelings [PITY, SYMPATHY, EXCITE]).

0902386F348D48B0B557EB4DDF892550.description:
Demonstrate understanding of signs by relating them to
their opposites (antonyms) and to words with similar but
not identical meanings (synonyms) (e.g., IMPROVE/DECLINE;
INCREASE/DECREASE).

557E89D55E224C9A9EA2C04352AD30C6.description:
Explain the meaning of simple similes and metaphors (e.g.,
BRAIN+CRACK, MIND+BLOW) in context.

FD477B9374C844E48F85DE5BDC080127.description:
Demonstrate understanding of figurative language, sign
relationships, and nuances in sign meanings.

84B363EB060C46AFA9C101D142803CAA.description:
Consult reference materials (e.g., dictionaries, glossaries,
thesauruses), both print and digital, to find the production
of and determine or clarify the precise meaning of key signs
and phrases.

A1CA0E3B16A9452893DEFA7C40BF0012.description:
Use common, grade-appropriate prefixes, suffixes,
non-manual markers, and iconicity of signs as clues to the
meaning of a sign (e.g., NMS: head shaking no, root LSF sign
TO-LOOK comes from “chercher” in French, CAT/WHISKERS).

70EE954FAB95453E981631895713E709.description:
Use context (e.g., definitions, examples, or restatements in
text) as a clue to the meaning of a sign, fingerspelled word,
or phrase.

9A63661218E24D2F91ECD3182E19534A.description:
Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiplemeaning signs, fingerspelled words, and phrases based on
grade 4 viewing and content, choosing flexibly from a range
of strategies.

5FE2ECC0904C48EE99508E0B60B93EC5.description:
Differentiate between contexts that call for formal ASL (e.g.,
presenting ideas) and situations where informal discourse is
appropriate (e.g., small-group discussion).

4C34B1F0ACAC475D8667F21DFECCCFD1.description:
Choose non-manual markers, fingerspelling, and sign choice
for effect.

4C83B4CE1EEE4AA9AF83D87EBE30B28F.description: Choose signs and phrases to convey ideas precisely.

61F8AC2C188D4389B971E66A33CB0FEA.description:
Use knowledge of language and its structure when signing
and viewing (live and published).

14C405EE755D4AE29EEC42CEB846F825.description:
Demonstrate command of the structure of standard ASL
grammar and usage when signing (live and published).

3EF5F9DDE70B439BB6C444579E355CD1.description:
Differentiate between contexts that call for formal ASL (e.g.,
presenting ideas) and situations where informal discourse
is appropriate (e.g., small-group discussion); use formal ASL
when appropriate to task and situation. (See grade 4 Language
standards 1)

C90E468B99074886AA210CC6CD1C1491.description:
Add video recordings and visual displays to presentations
when appropriate to enhance the development of main ideas
or themes.

B8C4D1169A2F4D3F811571B8C4FC56CA.description:
Report on a topic or text, tell a story, or recount an experience
in an organized manner using appropriate facts and relevant,
descriptive details to support main ideas or themes; sign
clearly at an understandable pace.

DBEB48FDF41440E6BC5F23DE3C10FC58.description:
Identify the reasons and evidence a signer provides to support
particular points.

AD0768B3B4C24C5790202209E818B10B.description:
Paraphrase portions of a text signed or information presented
in diverse media and formats, live or published, including
those with visual or quantitative information.

7910D321D14F41FB9B99A6FDEA0E8CAE.description:
Review the key ideas expressed and explain their own ideas
and understanding in light of the discussion.

D1004321B9014B3FA3E4713916981D9B.description:
Pose and respond to specific questions to clarify or follow up
on information, and make comments that contribute to the
discussion and link to the remarks of others.

889108D53D114A99B75F320415958BAC.description:
Follow agreed-upon rules for discussions and carry out
assigned roles.

7D25603BAD1D494D800392CDCDFDC176.description:
Come to discussions prepared, having viewed or studied
required material; explicitly draw on that preparation and
other information known about the topic to explore ideas
under discussion.

5D7DF7281A3A44FF8AB69D108C2AF7A4.description:
Engage effectively in a range of collaborative discussions (e.g.,
one-on-one, in groups, teacher-led) with diverse partners
on grade 4 topics and texts, building on others’ ideas and
expressing their own clearly.

BAB8A6911BD044A1865E2743EE0E4276.description:
Sign routinely over extended time frames (e.g., time for
research, reflection, and revision) and shorter time frames (e.g.,
a single sitting or a day or two) for a range of discipline-specific
tasks, purposes, and audiences.

735468991A774137B40ED0DC1D005BE7.description:
Apply grade 4 Viewing standards to informational texts
(e.g., “Explain how an author uses reasons and evidence to
support particular points in a text.”).

12471C23A70A4A748EB8158F41B10342.description:
Apply grade 4 Viewing standards to literature (e.g., “Describe
in depth a character, setting, or event in a story or drama,
drawing on specific details in the text [e.g., a character’s
thoughts, signs, or actions].”).

E92DE297AC8945AD9E0083C193715E79.description:
Draw evidence from literary or informational texts to support
analysis, reflection, and research.

3FC6E12A1CF344628420B8BAB7F93772.description:
Recall relevant information from experiences or gather
relevant information from print and digital sources; take notes
and categorize information, and provide a list of sources.

3F43B268FEAB4187AB7ECE7975673458.description:
Conduct short research projects that build knowledge through
investigation of different aspects of a topic.

282605A1A4F6459DB050961F1D1193B9.description: Research to Build and Present Knowledge

1F3F1ED0484B432A8C52E137889A9EAA.description:
With some guidance and support from adults, use technology,
including the Internet, to produce and publish signing as
well as to interact and collaborate with others; demonstrate
sufficient command of video editing skills to compose a
minimum of two minutes of video).

33E7FF346D494D6B8C1DE7D84AFA03E6.description:
With guidance and support from peers and adults, develop
and strengthen signing as needed by planning, revising, and
editing. (Editing for structure should demonstrate command
of Language standards 1-3 up to and including grade 4.)

4C0C6E3ED9804BB08C4B58C1F73FDCDA.description:
Produce clear and coherent signing in which the development
and organization are appropriate to task, purpose, and
audience. (Grade-specific expectations for signing types are
defined in standards 1-3 above.)

00912DB508B54902BAC0B35E97A148C6.description: Production and Distribution of Published Signing

B7F47E4F186B47F18ECDFE5010E25F90.description:
Provide a conclusion that follows from the narrated
experiences or events.a narrator and/or characters; organize
an event sequence that unfolds naturally.

FEBBBE7132E4421C946E41D6D8ACBDFB.description:
Use concrete signs and phrases and sensory details to
convey experiences and events precisely.

B9C1F03F98974FC0B1D167A5F0B3AD85.description:
Use a variety of transitional signs and phrases to manage the
sequence of events.

3B7ADE197AC341FEAF855DE14DDF53D7.description:
Use dialogue (role-shifting) and description to develop
experiences and events or show the responses of characters
to situations.

093FFA23AD0647D1BC22934F927D9946.description:
Orient the viewer by establishing a situation and introducing
a narrator and/or characters; organize an event sequence
that unfolds naturally.

72D74DFB4DD742E8AADFF7FFDA5B44CE.description:
Sign narratives to develop real or imagined experiences or
events using effective technique, descriptive details, and clear
event sequences.

C79865C4421C4BD582DF8057AB7C80D1.description:
Provide a concluding statement or section related to the
information or explanation presented.

D31F944D19124CD49265E4EE8C641659.description:
Use precise language and domain-specific vocabulary to
inform about or explain the topic.

5CB5A59A5C484451A1A049FB899645C8.description:
Link ideas within categories of information using signs and
phrases (e.g., OTHER, ALSO, RH-Q WHY, list referents).

86F5D106EF8E40388811C0FAFF577548.description:
Develop the topic with facts, definitions, concrete details,
quotations, or other information and examples related to
the topic.

4A3674C2AD0F4606AF673781DF880299.description:
Introduce a topic clearly and group related information in
paragraphs and sections; include formatting (e.g., video
transitions), illustrations, and multimedia when useful to
aiding comprehension.

D609979D562C43C9A2B837B6C5AF42E9.description:
Sign informative/explanatory texts to examine a topic and
convey ideas and information clearly.

75B1203F21B84B86ACC8BEC25AD858DB.description:
Provide a concluding statement or section related to the
opinion presented.

0D8D16E462064917BC3E7A7A211DD105.description:
Link opinion and reasons using signs and phrases (e.g., FOR
EXAMPLE, RH-Q HOW, ALSO, IDEA-SAME, ADD).

7728B8E77A9C462B921CEBB68909FEA1.description: Provide reasons that are supported by facts and details.

7E534935E1D94890AE7B300B45E7D2CD.description:
Introduce a topic or text clearly, state an opinion, and create
an organizational structure in which related ideas are
grouped to support the signer’s purpose.

884D9A012AD14FE2968929BD8C2549A2.description:
Sign opinion pieces on topics or texts, supporting a point of
view with reasons and information.

7F94F9BB266F47229876F72C34002996.description:
Use context to confirm or self-correct sign recognition and
understanding, re-viewing as necessary.

358C9AA85EF34F22AF4121FEC26BEC0C.description:
View and recite on-level text prose and poetry with accuracy,
appropriate rate, and expression on successive viewings for
both published and live texts.

5D3A06954CEF4E009BD4ED55292C3A16.description: View on-level text with purpose and understanding.

B78F8DEF0C9C452DB3299221027E86C8.description:
View and sign on-level texts with sufficient accuracy and
fluency to support comprehension.

0FA7AA6290C24A75AED5A771D1301F36.description:
Use combined knowledge of all parameters and morphology
(e.g., roots, affixes, and depictions) to accurately decode
unfamiliar signs and phrases in context and out of context.

179B9522B0B14B07A2F0A9F15C318220.description:
Know and apply grade-level sign analysis skills in decoding
signs.

18A271E43FA5443C99C72AB47507EDE3.description:
By the end of the year, view and comprehend informational
texts, including history/social studies, science, and technical
texts, at the high end of the grades 4-5 text complexity band,
with scaffolding as needed at the high end of the range.

8A69E0D6A9B342528DD936F5379AE523.description: Range of Viewing and Level of Text Complexity

3090F61ACC664C6C80F28033F5720C48.description:
Integrate information from two texts on the same topic in
order to narrate about the subject knowledgeably.

2A9F4F220DAF4C92A80B1D1970D93C8C.description:
Explain how an author uses reasons and evidence to support
particular points in a text.

DA4E3274316F4C59BF4CB8BE960AD3F0.description:
Interpret information presented live or published that may
include quantitative or visual information (e.g., in charts,
graphs, diagrams, time lines, animations, or interactive
elements on web pages) and explain how the information
contributes to an understanding of the text in which it
appears.

C0CCF78AF6704C82906FA3FE064F1A10.description:
Compare and contrast a firsthand and secondhand account of
the same event or topic; describe the differences in focus and
the information provided.

03B8A3FD64284139B0F299B8A985538D.description:
Describe the overall structure (e.g., chronology, comparison,
cause/effect, problem/solution) of events, ideas, concepts, or
information in a text or part of a text.

F863382A19A74860BE13A4A1E8B4156C.description:
Determine the meaning of general academic and domainspecific words and phrases in a text relevant to a grade 4 topic
or subject area.

85A882721B19417CB26FDFDB8215F9E1.description:
Explain events, procedures, ideas, or concepts in a historical,
scientific, or technical text, including what happened and why,
based on specific information in the text.

CDF3AEDC98334925827E66216CB7334A.description:
Determine the main idea of a text and explain how it is
supported by key details; summarize the text.

EAD51185CE46426481802E84E268A5B0.description:
Refer to details and examples in a text when explaining what
the text says explicitly and when drawing inferences from the
text.

7C9A8780FF2F42F4BA80B35EF4DCFC58.description:
By the end of the year, view and comprehend literature,
including stories, dramas, and poetry, in the grades 4–5 text
complexity band proficiently, with scaffolding as needed at
the high end of the range.

A4DF10AEFB3C413DA53046752CB280C3.description: Range of Viewing and Level of Text Complexity

04331A790DA34BE1800B260567DE3A82.description:
Compare and contrast the treatment of similar themes
and topics (e.g., opposition of good and evil) and patterns
of events (e.g., the quest) in stories, myths, and traditional
literature from different cultures.

EFB73197D7744938B3228E42825B8CF7.description:
Make connections between the text of a story or drama and a
visual or oral presentation of the text, identifying where each
version reflects specific descriptions and directions in the text.

C449DAE8E7354C04B9D03AE1D948A379.description:
Compare and contrast the point of view from which different
stories are narrated, including the difference between firstand third-person narrations.

504F7840A94647F9B63A7686D2D67323.description:
Explain major differences between poems, drama, and
prose, and refer to the structural elements of poems (e.g.,
handshapes, numbers, patterns, rhyme, rhythm) and drama
(e.g., casts of characters, settings, dialogue, descriptions, stage
directions) when signing about a text.

B97CF7AA673C493887A857B11F94381C.description:
Determine the meaning of signs and phrases as they are used
in a text, including those that allude to significant characters
found in mythology and other literature.

6C8CB25138594E96A81A391B46B229AF.description:
Describe in depth a character, setting, or event in a story or
drama, drawing on specific details in the text (e.g., a character’s
thoughts, signs, or actions).

23EC6ABFA96C4903ADFE14584AF40675.description:
Determine a theme of a story, drama, or poem from details in
the text; summarize the text.

AF7A9286C341421089DC2C610393ADAE.description:
Refer to details and examples in a text when explaining what
the text says explicitly and when drawing inferences from the
text.
